item.title: Everyday Carry
item.description: I love reading what other people carry with them on a daily basis. So here is my list. Bag The North Face Berkeley Satchel in black. Watch Casio Edifice EFS-S510L-1AVUEF Solar Phone iPhone 8+ in Space Grey with the standard Apple leather case in black. Headphones JBL T110 BT Pen Retro 51 Tornado Stealth Notebook Rhodia Blac No12 Lined Shopping Bag Susan Bijl shopping bag large

item.title: February 2020
item.description: TV The Man in the High Castle S02 / S03 / S04 What a fantastic show! In the first couple of episodes I thought it was some kind of love story or something. But it turned in to some sci-fi stuff I absolutely love. Movies Ready Player One Read the book, liked it. Saw the movie in the cinema, left halfway, dit not like it at all.

item.title: I Just Want To Play A Video Game...
iPad
item.description: Thinking more and more about making the iPad my main computing device. Not the Pro, don’t really see the point in owning one (besides the bigger screen), but my 2018 iPad. The more I sit behind my MacBook (and the more stories I read about people who made the transition), the more I think: can’t I do this on my iPad? With a clicky keyboard. Obviously… I’m looking for a small stand for the iPad, so it can stand up nicely on my desk and I don’t need to look down constantly.

item.title: Mario Kart Tour
item.description: Why the hell would you pay 5 dollar a month for a 200CC mode in Mario Kart?? There is no controller support and you can only play it in portrait mode. Rather amusingly, one of the in-app purchase options is a $4.99 subscription for extra items … the same price as Apple Arcade’s entire 100-game library. 9 to 5 Mac

item.title: Apple Arcade First Impression
item.description: Yesterday I installed iOS 13 on my iPhone 8+. I also started the Apple Arcade trial. As with all mobile games: touch controls suck. A lot. I played these games with my PS4 controller. Pairing it with my iPhone took 10 seconds: press the PS button and the share button on your controller at the same time, and hold it for a few seconds. Open the bluetooth settings on your phone and click on the Dualshock controller.

item.title: Seneca
item.description: ISBN: 9789025369576 Het leven is, wanneer je ermee kunt omgaan lang! Het is te laat te beginnen met leven bij de finish. Verstandige plannen uitstellen tot je vijftigste of zestigste, je leven willen starten op een punt dat weinigen bereiken: wat een dom gebrek aan bewustzijn van je sterfelijkheid. Het leven dat we krijgen is niet kort, wij maken het kort; we hebben er niet te weinig van, we gooien het met bakken overboord.

item.title: About
item.description: I’m Jan-Willem Boelens. I’m 39 years old, live in Rotterdam and have a cat. His name is Bob. He thinks he is a dog. When I am not sleeping or thinking about sleep, I ride my bike or try to take half decent photographs. Someday I will build a website for my photos, today is not that day… I don’t have any social media accounts. Colophon This website is built with Hugo.

item.title: Books
item.description: De lengte van het leven Seneca 21.08.2019 Dune DNF Frank Herbert 13.08.2019 Artemis Andy Weir 07.06.2018 Stoïcijnse levenskunst: evenveel geluk als wijsheid Miriam van Reijen 31.05.2018 Meditations ★ Marcus Aurelius 30.05.2018 Redenen om te blijven leven Matt Haig 02.04.2018 De zeven eigenschappen voor succes in je leven Stephen Covey 28.03.2018 Minimalism for Regular People Michael Martins 31.03.2018 Everything That Remains: A Memoir by The Minimalists Joshua Fields Millburn 30.03.2018 Essentialisme

item.title: EDC
item.description: Computer My laptop is a ThinkPad T420 from 2011 with an i5-2520M, 8GB of ram and 120GB of storage. It runs the latest version of Manjaro. Even though my laptop is 8 years old, it still runs fine on Manjaro. My mouse is a Logitech MX Ergo. I use the standard text editor to edit this site. My browser of choice is Firefox, with Ghostery for ad blocking. Firefox syncs with my phone and is fast, even on this laptop.

item.title: Quotes
item.description: There’s always a chance of clouds, but the idea of the blue sky will help things feel a little bit lighter. Headspace I like coffee so much that I have tea for breakfast: The first cup of the day in particular is so good that I’m afraid I won’t be able to properly appreciate it when I am half-asleep. Therefore, I celebrate it two hours later when I am fully conscious.
